author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
From the core of the sovereign realm, a tale I do unveil,
A goat has cropped the greens, the count so hearty, hale.
Bonds of Eurozone in twilight's glance ahead,
Barclays finds the past outmatched, a year old web, it shed.

In the meadow's tender care, the hare tips forth to rise,
Oil, the lifeblood, flows, its gain a sweet surprise.
From Arabia and Russia, the chosen cuts have lined,
In storied troves, they flicker, a fortune well designed.

Beneath the moon, the snail trails gold, the gleaming path it threads,
Base and noble metals stirred, as dollar softly treads.
From the vault of the imperial East, support for brick and wheel,
Kindles demand, brightness sways, as market worries heal.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Sovereigns' Bond Funding Completion Is Ahead of 2022 Level
feedItems.description: Eurozone sovereign issuers have completed around 67% of planned gross bond funding for the year, around 4 percentage points ahead the corresponding period in 2022, Barclays said.

feedItems.title: Oil Set for Fourth Weekly Rise
feedItems.description: Oil prices rose and were on course for a fourth weekly gain as evidence supply cuts from Saudi Arabia and Russia have begun to show up in inventories.

feedItems.title: Metals Rise as Dollar Slips
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold prices pushed higher as a weaker dollar and reports of Chinese government support for real estate and the auto market helped boost demand.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Unseen as if by Odin's shroud, SAP doth wield power proud,
Gains in aether's marketplace, an outcome of their cloud's embrace.
Mighty profits in their grasp, a golden future they do clasp,
Warrior-strong their claims prolong, in core cloud realms they belong.

Hear ye now of Nikkei's fall, heed the raven's dire call,
Iron-harbingers tumble down, drowned by Aegir, they are found.
Midst the tightening of bank’s cord, unsure of what the future hoard,
Beware the tempest that may brew, with global outlook in askew.

Alas! Dassault, the hawk of trade, falters in the market glade,
Lower sales and orders gleaned, trading in the shadows, screened.
Yet, even Thor strikes not in vain, they pledge their guidance shall sustain,
Facing shadows, unbowed, unbroken, by Loki's whispers, are unspoken.

feedItems.title: SAP Tweaks Guidance After 2Q Sales, Profit Boost
feedItems.description: Software company said results driven by strong growth at its core cloud business.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.6%, Dragged by Chip, Electronics Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in chip and other electronics stocks as caution continues over policy tightening by central banks and the global economic outlook.

feedItems.title: Dassault Aviation Slumps on Lower Sales
feedItems.description: Dassault traded 6.8% lower in early trading after it reported a decrease in sales and order intake in the first half of the year, but backed its full-year guidance.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In lands afar, the Bear doth sway,
Ukrainian hearts to keep at bay.
Seeks to steer their battle cuffs,
In the north, where conflict roughs.

Lonza, in dismay, does confess,
Market tides its gains compress.
In the realm of pills and cure,
Demand now lower, profits unsure.

Hark, the market's whispers float,
A higher dollar, bond yields denote.
Silent are the traders' games,
Awaiting Fed and ECB's claims.

feedItems.title: Russia Seeks to Divert Ukrainian Forces Away From Counteroffensive
feedItems.description: As Ukrainian forces edge forward in the south and east of the country, Russia is pressing an offensive in the north.

feedItems.title: Lonza Cuts Guidance on Lower Demand
feedItems.description: Lonza lowered its sales target and core Ebitda margin for 2023, as current market dynamics are hurting demand for early-stage services and nutraceutical capsules.

feedItems.title: US Bond Yields Suggest Dollar Could Be Higher; Trade Quiet Before Fed, ECB Decisions
feedItems.description: U.S. short-term bond yield moves suggest the dollar, which rose to an eight-day high against a basket of currencies this week, could be higher, ING said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Safran ascends, in His heavenward flight,
To gain the actuator's powerful might.
Just as monks seek God with heartfelt delight,
So a billion, eightfold, seals their intent.

In the kingdom of retail, a merry rise,
In June's summer cheer, a happy surprise.
With both food and trinkets, they seek the prize,
For the season of sales, worth every spent.

Oh, rejoice! Danske Bank trumpets the news,
Rich in earnings, it sets a jolly fuse.
Just as a monk prays, and God's grace renews,
So does the firm bask, in profits' ascent.

feedItems.title: Safran to Buy Collins Aerospace's Flight Control Business
feedItems.description: Safran said it plans to acquire the actuation and flight-control business from Raytheon Technologies’ Collins Aerospace unit in a cash offer that values the target at $1.8 billion including debt.

feedItems.title: UK Retail Sales Rises More Than Expected
feedItems.description: U.K. retail sales volumes ticked up 0.7% in June, driven by both food and nonfood purchases, after the start of summer promotional season increased footfall.

feedItems.title: Danske Bank Ups Guidance After Earnings Beat
feedItems.description: Danske Bank raised its full-year earnings guidance and announced an interim dividend after reporting a higher-than-expected second-quarter profit boosted by higher net interest income.
